ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, if you want a well designed but programming intensive class.

CS 478 is an overview of computer graphics. Topics are not covered in the depth that they should be covered in, and the rigor andattention to detail that one would expect from a computer science course are missing. Some of the programming assignments expect a level of understanding beyond what the course provides and sometimes beyond what the textbook provides. There were also some issues with grading. I don't recommend taking the course unless you're looking to be frustrated.

It's mostly what you expect. You go over basic techniques in modeling and rendering. My biggest criticism is that the work/learning ratio is fairly crappy. I spent most of my time figuring out how to implement fairly simple ideas in C++, but I also didn't have a great background in C/C++.
